SourceProxy.name: FluxVectors
SourceProxy.label: Flux Vectors

Documentation.long_help: Convert scalars to flux or circulation vectors.

SourceProxy.Documentation: Often times a simulation that computes circulation or flux in a mesh will simply write out the scalar that represents the amount of movement and the direction is implied by the normal of the surface cell (for flux) or the direction of the line cell (for circulation). This filter converts the scalar representation to the vector representation.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.label: Flux/Circulation Array
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the scalar array that represents flux through a 2D element or circulation through a 1D element. This array will be converted to a vector pointing in the direction the flow or circulation is moving.

SourceProxy.name: FluxGlyphs
SourceProxy.label: Flux Glyphs

Documentation.long_help: Create glyphs pointing in the direction of flux or circulation.

SourceProxy.Documentation: Circulation is a vector field on 1D cells that represents flow along the path of the cell. Flux is a vector field on 2D cells that represents flow through the area of the cell. This filter creates arrow glyphs in the direction of the flow.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.label: Flux/Circulation Array
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the scalar or vector array that represents flux through a 2D element or circulation through a 1D element. If necessary, this array will be converted to a vector pointing in the direction the flow or circulation is moving.

SourceProxy.name: CirculationFeatures
SourceProxy.label: Circulation Features

Documentation.long_help: Find sources, sinks, and saddles in circulation fields.

SourceProxy.Documentation: Given a set of line elements with a circulation scalar or vector field on the cells, compute the "feature" points. Features are sources, sinks, or saddles in the circulation. Any one of these is identified by vectors facing the opposite direction. Since the input can be unstructured and deformed, the features are estimated by finding the average circulation vector on each point and seeing if any attached circulation vector points more than 90 degrees in a different direction.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.label: Circulation Array
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the array that represents circulation through a 1D element. This array can be either a scalar (in which case it points in the direction of the line element) or a vector.
